intro: Cereus baumannii var. flavispinus, commonly known as the yellow-spined cactus, is a species of cactus native to South America. It is characterized by its tall, cylindrical stems that are often sparsely covered with white or yellow spines. The plant produces large, showy flowers that are typically white or pink, which bloom at night. It thrives in arid and semi-arid environments, requiring well-drained soil and full sun exposure. Due to its striking appearance, it is often cultivated as an ornamental plant.
